entities.Name: Action Authorizations
entities.Description: Links actions to authorizations, one or more of these must be possessed by a user in order to execute the action.

entities.Name: Action Categories
entities.Description: Organizes actions into categories, including name, description, and optional parent category for hierarchy.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Description: Name of the action category.

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the action category.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Status of the action category (Pending, Active, Disabled).

entities.Name: Action Context Types
entities.Description: Lists possible contexts for action execution with optional descriptions.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Description: Name of the context type.

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the context type.

entities.Name: Action Contexts
entities.Description: Links actions to their supported context types enabling a given action to be executable in more than one context.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Status of the action context (Pending, Active, Disabled).

entities.Name: Action Execution Logs
entities.Description: Tracks every execution of an action, including start and end times, inputs, outputs, and result codes.

Fields.Name: StartedAt
Fields.Description: Timestamp of when the action started execution.

Fields.Name: EndedAt
Fields.Description: Timestamp of when the action ended execution.

Fields.Name: RetentionPeriod
Fields.Description: Number of days to retain the log; NULL for indefinite retention.

entities.Name: Action Filters
entities.Description: Defines filters that can be evaluated ahead of executing an action. Action Filters are usable in any code pipeline you can execute them with the same context as the action itself and use the outcome to determine if the action should execute or not.

entities.Name: Action Libraries
entities.Description: Tracks the list of libraries that a given Action uses, including a list of classes/functions for each library.

Fields.Name: ItemsUsed
Fields.Description: List of classes and functions used by the action from the library.

entities.Name: Action Params
entities.Description: Tracks the input and output parameters for Actions.

Fields.Name: ValueType
Fields.Description: Tracks the basic value type of the parameter, additional information can be provided in the Description field

entities.Name: Action Result Codes
entities.Description: Defines the possible result codes for each action.

Fields.Name: IsSuccess
Fields.Description: Indicates if the result code is a success or not. It is possible an action might have more than one failure condition/result code and same for success conditions.

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the result code.

entities.Name: Actions
entities.Description: Stores action definitions, including prompts, generated code, user comments, and status.

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: Generated or Custom. Generated means the UserPrompt is used to prompt an AI model to automatically create the code for the Action. Custom means that a custom class has been implemented that subclasses the BaseAction class. The custom class needs to use the @RegisterClass decorator and be included in the MJAPI (or other runtime environment) to be available for execution.

Fields.Name: UserComments
Fields.Description: User's comments not shared with the LLM.

Fields.Name: CodeComments
Fields.Description: AI's explanation of the code.

Fields.Name: CodeApprovalStatus
Fields.Description: An action won't be usable until the code is approved.

Fields.Name: CodeApprovalComments
Fields.Description: Optional comments when an individual (or an AI) reviews and approves the code.

Fields.Name: CodeApprovedAt
Fields.Description: When the code was approved.

Fields.Name: CodeLocked
Fields.Description: If set to 1, Code will never be generated by the AI system. This overrides all other settings including the ForceCodeGeneration bit

Fields.Name: ForceCodeGeneration
Fields.Description: If set to 1, the Action will generate code for the provided UserPrompt on the next Save even if the UserPrompt hasn't changed. This is useful to force regeneration when other candidates (such as a change in Action Inputs/Outputs) occurs or on demand by a user.

Fields.Name: RetentionPeriod
Fields.Description: Number of days to retain execution logs; NULL for indefinite.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Status of the action (Pending, Active, Disabled).

entities.Name: AI Actions
entities.Description: List of all actions that are possible across all AI Models

entities.Name: AI Model Actions
entities.Description: Tracks the actions supported by each AI Model

entities.Name: AI Model Types
entities.Description: Types of AI Models

entities.Name: AI Models
entities.Description: Catalog of all AI Models configured in the system

Fields.Name: PowerRank
Fields.Description: A simplified power rank of each model for a given AI Model Type. For example, if we have GPT 3, GPT 3.5, and GPT 4, we would have a PowerRank of 1 for GPT3, 2 for GPT 3.5, and 3 for GPT 4. This can be used within model families like OpenAI or across all models. For example if you had Llama 2 in the mix which is similar to GPT 3.5 it would also have a PowerRank of 2. This can be used at runtime to pick the most/least powerful or compare model relative power.

Fields.Name: APIName
Fields.Description: The name of the model to use with API calls which might differ from the Name, if APIName is not provided, Name will be used for API calls

entities.Name: Application Entities
entities.Description: List of entities within each application. An application can have any number of entities and an entity can be part of any number of applications.

Fields.Name: DefaultForNewUser
Fields.Description: When set to 1, the entity will be included by default for a new user when they first access the application in question

entities.Name: Applications
entities.Description: Applications are used to group entities in the user interface for ease of user access

Fields.Name: Icon
Fields.Description: Specify the CSS class information for the display icon for each application.

Fields.Name: DefaultForNewUser
Fields.Description: If turned on, when a new user first uses the MJ Explorer app, the application records with this turned on will have this application included in their selected application list.

Fields.Name: UseAuditLog
Fields.Description: When set to 1, Audit Log records are created whenever this authorization is invoked for a user

entities.Name: Communication Base Message Types
entities.Description: Base message types and their supported functionalities.

Fields.Name: SupportsAttachments
Fields.Description: Indicates if attachments are supported.

Fields.Name: SupportsSubjectLine
Fields.Description: Indicates if a subject line is supported.

Fields.Name: SupportsHtml
Fields.Description: Indicates if HTML content is supported.

Fields.Name: MaxBytes
Fields.Description: The maximum size in bytes for the message.

entities.Name: Communication Logs
entities.Description: Logs of sent and received messages.

Fields.Name: Direction
Fields.Description: The direction of the communication log (Sending or Receiving).

Fields.Name: MessageDate
Fields.Description: The date and time when the message was logged.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: The status of the logged message (Pending, In-Progress, Complete, Failed).

Fields.Name: MessageContent
Fields.Description: The content of the logged message.

Fields.Name: ErrorMessage
Fields.Description: The error message if the message sending failed.

entities.Name: Communication Provider Message Types
entities.Description: Providers and their supported message types with additional attributes.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: The status of the provider message type (Disabled or Active).

Fields.Name: AdditionalAttributes
Fields.Description: Additional attributes specific to the provider message type.

entities.Name: Communication Providers
entities.Description: All supported communication providers.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: The status of the communication provider (Disabled or Active).

Fields.Name: SupportsSending
Fields.Description: Indicates if the provider supports sending messages.

Fields.Name: SupportsReceiving
Fields.Description: Indicates if the provider supports receiving messages.

entities.Name: Communication Runs
entities.Description: Runs of bulk message sends and receives.

Fields.Name: Direction
Fields.Description: The direction of the communication run (Sending or Receiving).

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: The status of the communication run (Pending, In-Progress, Complete, Failed).

Fields.Name: ErrorMessage
Fields.Description: The error message if the communication run failed.

entities.Name: Companies
entities.Description: A list of organizational units within your business. These can be subsidiaries or divisions or other units. Companies are used to organizae employee records and also for separating integrations if you have multiple integrations of the same type of system.

entities.Name: Company Integrations
entities.Description: Links individual company records to specific integrations

entities.Name: Dashboards
entities.Description: Dashboards are used to group resources into a single display pane for an end-user

entities.Name: Data Context Items
entities.Description: Data Context Items store information about each item within a Data Context. Each item stores a link to a view, query, or raw sql statement and can optionally cache the JSON representing the last run of that data object as well.

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: The type of the item, either "view", "query", "full_entity", "single_record", or "sql"

Fields.Name: RecordID
Fields.Description: The Primary Key value for the record, only used when Type='single_record'

Fields.Name: SQL
Fields.Description: Only used when Type=sql

Fields.Name: DataJSON
Fields.Description: Optionally used to cache results of an item. This can be used for performance optimization, and also for having snapshots of data for historical comparisons.

Fields.Name: LastRefreshedAt
Fields.Description: If DataJSON is populated, this field will show the date the the data was captured

entities.Name: Data Contexts
entities.Description: Data Contexts are a primitive within the MemberJunction architecture. They store information about data contexts which are groups of data including views, queries, or raw SQL statements. Data contexts can be used in conversations, reports and more.

entities.Name: Dataset Items
entities.Description: A single item in a Dataset and can be sourced from multiple methods.

entities.Name: Datasets
entities.Description: Cacheable sets of data that can span one or more items

Fields.Name: MatchSource
Fields.Description: Either Vector or SP

Fields.Name: MatchProbability
Fields.Description: Value between 0 and 1 designating the computed probability of a match

Fields.Name: SkippedReason
Fields.Description: If MatchStatus=Skipped, this field can be used to store the reason why the record was skipped

Fields.Name: MatchErrorMessage
Fields.Description: If MatchStatus='Error' this field can be used to track the error from that phase of the process for logging/diagnostics.

entities.Name: Employees
entities.Description: A list of employees across all units of your organization

entities.Name: Entities
entities.Description: Catalog of all entities across all schemas

Fields.Name: AutoUpdateDescription
Fields.Description: When set to 1 (default), whenever a description is modified in the underlying view (first choice) or table (second choice), the Description column in the entity definition will be automatically updated. If you never set metadata in the database directly, you can leave this alone. However, if you have metadata set in the database level for description, and you want to provide a DIFFERENT description in this entity definition, turn this bit off and then set the Description field and future CodeGen runs will NOT override the Description field here.

Fields.Name: BaseViewGenerated
Fields.Description: When set to 0, CodeGen no longer generates a base view for the entity.

Fields.Name: TrackRecordChanges
Fields.Description: When set to 1, changes made via the MemberJunction architecture will result in tracking records being created in the RecordChange table. In addition, when turned on CodeGen will ensure that your table has two fields: __mj_CreatedAt and __mj_UpdatedAt which are special fields used in conjunction with the RecordChange table to track changes to rows in your entity.

Fields.Name: AuditRecordAccess
Fields.Description: When set to 1, accessing a record by an end-user will result in an Audit Log record being created

Fields.Name: AuditViewRuns
Fields.Description: When set to 1, users running a view against this entity will result in an Audit Log record being created.

Fields.Name: IncludeInAPI
Fields.Description: If set to 0, the entity will not be available at all in the GraphQL API or the object model.

Fields.Name: AllowAllRowsAPI
Fields.Description: If set to 1, a GraphQL query will be enabled that allows access to all rows in the entity.

Fields.Name: AllowUpdateAPI
Fields.Description: Global flag controlling if updates are allowed for any user, or not. If set to 1, a GraqhQL mutation and stored procedure are created. Permissions are still required to perform the action but if this flag is set to 0, no user will be able to perform the action.

Fields.Name: AllowCreateAPI
Fields.Description: Global flag controlling if creates are allowed for any user, or not. If set to 1, a GraqhQL mutation and stored procedure are created. Permissions are still required to perform the action but if this flag is set to 0, no user will be able to perform the action.

Fields.Name: AllowDeleteAPI
Fields.Description: Global flag controlling if deletes are allowed for any user, or not. If set to 1, a GraqhQL mutation and stored procedure are created. Permissions are still required to perform the action but if this flag is set to 0, no user will be able to perform the action.

Fields.Name: CustomResolverAPI
Fields.Description: Set to 1 if a custom resolver has been created for the entity.

Fields.Name: AllowUserSearchAPI
Fields.Description: Enabling this bit will result in search being possible at the API and UI layers

Fields.Name: CascadeDeletes
Fields.Description: When set to 1, the deleted spDelete will pre-process deletion to related entities that have 1:M cardinality with this entity. This does not have effect if spDeleteGenerated = 0

Fields.Name: DeleteType
Fields.Description: Hard deletes physically remove rows from the underlying BaseTable. Soft deletes do not remove rows but instead mark the row as deleted by using the special field __mj_DeletedAt which will automatically be added to the entity's basetable by the CodeGen tool.

Fields.Name: AllowRecordMerge
Fields.Description: This field must be turned on in order to enable merging of records for the entity. For AllowRecordMerge to be turned on, AllowDeleteAPI must be set to 1, and DeleteType must be set to Soft

Fields.Name: spMatch
Fields.Description: When specified, this stored procedure is used to find matching records in this particular entity. The convention is to pass in the primary key(s) columns for the given entity to the procedure and the return will be zero to many rows where there is a column for each primary key field(s) and a ProbabilityScore (numeric(1,12)) column that has a 0 to 1 value of the probability of a match.

Fields.Name: RelationshipDefaultDisplayType
Fields.Description: When another entity links to this entity with a foreign key, this is the default component type that will be used in the UI. CodeGen will populate the RelatedEntityDisplayType column in the Entity Fields entity with whatever is provided here whenever a new foreign key is detected by CodeGen. The selection can be overridden on a per-foreign-key basis in each row of the Entity Fields entity.

Fields.Name: PreferredCommunicationField
Fields.Description: Used to specify a field within the entity that in turn contains the field name that will be used for record-level communication preferences. For example in a hypothetical entity called Contacts, say there is a field called PreferredComm and that field had possible values of Email1, SMS, and Phone, and those value in turn corresponded to field names in the entity. Each record in the Contacts entity could have a specific preference for which field would be used for communication. The MJ Communication Framework will use this information when available, as a priority ahead of the data in the Entity Communication Fields entity which is entity-level and not record-level.

Fields.Name: Icon
Fields.Description: Optional, specify an icon (CSS Class) for each entity for display in the UI

entities.Name: Entity Action Filters
entities.Description: Optional use. Maps Action Filters to specific EntityAction instances, specifying execution order and status. This allows for pre-processing before an Action actually is fired off, to check for various state/dirty/value conditions.

Fields.Name: Sequence
Fields.Description: Order of filter execution.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Status of the entity action filter (Pending, Active, Disabled).

entities.Name: Entity Action Invocation Types
entities.Description: Stores the possible invocation types of an action within the context of an entity. Examples would be: Record Created/Updated/Deleted/Accessed as well as things like View or List where you could run an EntityAction against an entire set of records in a view or list  either by user click or programmatically.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Description: Name of the invocation type such as Record Created/Updated/etc.

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the invocation type.

entities.Name: Entity Action Invocations
entities.Description: Links invocation types to entity actions  for example you might link a particular EntityAction to just Create Record and you might also have a second item in this table allowing the same Entity Action to be invoked from a User View or List, on demand.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Status of the entity action invocation (Pending, Active, Disabled).

entities.Name: Entity Action Params
entities.Description: Stores paramater mappings to enable Entity Actions to automatically invoke Actions

Fields.Name: ValueType
Fields.Description: Type of the value, which can be Static, Entity Object, or Script.

Fields.Name: Value
Fields.Description: Value of the parameter, used only when ValueType is Static or Script. When value is Script, any valid JavaScript code can be provided. The script will have access to an object called EntityActionContext. This object will have a property called EntityObject on it that will contain the BaseEntity derived sub-class with the current data for the entity object this action is operating against. The script must provide the parameter value to the EntityActionContext.result property. This scripting capabilty is designed for very small and simple code, for anything of meaningful complexity, create a sub-class instead.

Fields.Name: Comments
Fields.Description: Additional comments regarding the parameter.

entities.Name: Entity Actions
entities.Description: Links entities to actions - this is the main place where you define the actions that part of, or available, for a given entity.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Status of the entity action (Pending, Active, Disabled).

entities.Name: Entity AI Actions
entities.Description: Tracks the AI actions that should be invoked based on changes to records within a given entity.

entities.Name: Entity Communication Fields
entities.Description: Mapping between entity fields and communication base message types with priority

Fields.Name: FieldName
Fields.Description: Name of the field in the entity that maps to the communication base message type

Fields.Name: Priority
Fields.Description: Priority of the field for the communication base message type

entities.Name: Entity Communication Message Types
entities.Description: Mapping between entities and communication base message types

Fields.Name: IsActive
Fields.Description: Indicates whether the message type is active

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Can be Pending, In Progress, Completed, or Failed

Fields.Name: PotentialMatchThreshold
Fields.Description: Value between 0 and 1 that determines what is considered a potential matching record. Value must be <= AbsoluteMatchThreshold. This is primarily used for duplicate detection but can be used for other applications as well where matching is relevant.

Fields.Name: AbsoluteMatchThreshold
Fields.Description: Value between 0 and 1 that determines what is considered an absolute matching record. Value must be >= PotentialMatchThreshold. This is primarily used for duplicate detection but can be used for other applications as well where matching is relevant.

entities.Name: Entity Fields
entities.Description: List of all fields within each entity with metadata about each field

Fields.Name: Sequence
Fields.Description: Display order of the field within the entity

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Description: Name of the field within the database table

Fields.Name: DisplayName
Fields.Description: A user friendly alternative to the field name

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Descriptive text explaining the purpose of the field

Fields.Name: AutoUpdateDescription
Fields.Description: When set to 1 (default), whenever a description is modified in the column within the underlying view (first choice) or table (second choice), the Description column in the entity field definition will be automatically updated. If you never set metadata in the database directly, you can leave this alone. However, if you have metadata set in the database level for description, and you want to provide a DIFFERENT description in this entity field definition, turn this bit off and then set the Description field and future CodeGen runs will NOT override the Description field here.

Fields.Name: IsPrimaryKey
Fields.Description: Indicates if the field is part of the primary key for the entity (auto maintained by CodeGen)

Fields.Name: IsUnique
Fields.Description: Indicates if the field must have unique values within the entity.

Fields.Name: Category
Fields.Description: Used for generating custom tabs in the generated forms, only utilized if GeneratedFormSection=Category

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: SQL Data type (auto maintained by CodeGen)

Fields.Name: Length
Fields.Description: SQL data length (auto maintained by CodeGen)

Fields.Name: Precision
Fields.Description: SQL precision (auto maintained by CodeGen)

Fields.Name: Scale
Fields.Description: SQL scale (auto maintained by CodeGen)

Fields.Name: AllowsNull
Fields.Description: Does the column allow null or not (auto maintained by CodeGen)

Fields.Name: DefaultValue
Fields.Description: If a default value is defined for the field it is stored here (auto maintained by CodeGen)

Fields.Name: AutoIncrement
Fields.Description: If this field automatically increments within the table, this field is set to 1 (auto maintained by CodeGen)

Fields.Name: ValueListType
Fields.Description: Possible Values of None, List, ListOrUserEntry - the last option meaning that the list of possible values are options, but a user can enter anything else desired too.

Fields.Name: ExtendedType
Fields.Description: Defines extended behaviors for a field such as for Email, Web URLs, Code, etc.

Fields.Name: CodeType
Fields.Description: The type of code associated with this field. Only used when the ExtendedType field is set to "Code"

Fields.Name: DefaultInView
Fields.Description: If set to 1, this field will be included by default in any new view created by a user.

Fields.Name: ViewCellTemplate
Fields.Description: NULL

Fields.Name: DefaultColumnWidth
Fields.Description: Determines the default width for this field when included in a view

Fields.Name: AllowUpdateAPI
Fields.Description: If set to 1, this field will be considered updateable by the API and object model. For this field to have effect, the column type must be updateable (e.g. not part of the primary key and not auto-increment)

Fields.Name: AllowUpdateInView
Fields.Description: If set to 1, and if AllowUpdateAPI=1, the field can be edited within a view when the view is in edit mode.

Fields.Name: IncludeInUserSearchAPI
Fields.Description: If set to 1, this column will be included in user search queries for both traditional and full text search

Fields.Name: FullTextSearchEnabled
Fields.Description: If set to 1, CodeGen will automatically generate a Full Text Catalog/Index in the database and include this field in the search index.

Fields.Name: UserSearchParamFormatAPI
Fields.Description: NULL

Fields.Name: IncludeInGeneratedForm
Fields.Description: If set to 1, this field will be included in the generated form by CodeGen. If set to 0, this field will be excluded from the generated form. For custom forms, this field has no effect as the layout is controlled independently.

Fields.Name: GeneratedFormSection
Fields.Description: When set to Top, the field will be placed in a "top area" on the top of a generated form and visible regardless of which tab is displayed. When set to "category" Options: Top, Category, Details

Fields.Name: IsVirtual
Fields.Description: NULL

Fields.Name: IsNameField
Fields.Description: If set to 1, this column will be used as the "Name" field for the entity and will be used to display the name of the record in various places in the UI.

Fields.Name: RelatedEntityFieldName
Fields.Description: Name of the field in the Related Entity that this field links to (auto maintained by CodeGen)

Fields.Name: IncludeRelatedEntityNameFieldInBaseView
Fields.Description: If set to 1, the "Name" field of the Related Entity will be included in this entity as a virtual field

Fields.Name: RelatedEntityDisplayType
Fields.Description: Controls the generated form in the MJ Explorer UI - defaults to a search box, other option is a drop down. Possible values are Search and Dropdown

Fields.Name: EntityIDFieldName
Fields.Description: Optional, used for "Soft Keys" to link records to different entity/record combinations on a per-record basis (for example the FileEntityRecordLink table has an EntityID/RecordID field pair. For that entity, the RecordID specifies "EntityID" for this field. This information allows MJ to detect soft keys/links for dependency detection, merging and for preventing orphaned soft-linked records during delete operations.

entities.Name: Entity Permissions
entities.Description: Security settings for each entity

entities.Name: Entity Relationship Display Components
entities.Description: This table stores a list of components that are available for displaying relationships in the MJ Explorer UI

Fields.Name: RelationshipType
Fields.Description: The type of relationship the component displays. Valid values are "One to Many", "Many to Many", or "Both".

entities.Name: Entity Relationships
entities.Description: Metadata about relationships between entities including display preferences for the UI

Fields.Name: Sequence
Fields.Description: Used for display order in generated forms and in other places in the UI where relationships for an entity are shown

Fields.Name: DisplayInForm
Fields.Description: When unchecked the relationship will NOT be displayed on the generated form

Fields.Name: DisplayName
Fields.Description: Optional, when specified this value overrides the related entity name for the label on the tab

Fields.Name: DisplayIconType
Fields.Description: When Related Entity Icon - uses the icon from the related entity, if one exists. When Custom, uses the value in the DisplayIcon field in this record, and when None, no icon is displayed

Fields.Name: DisplayIcon
Fields.Description: If specified, the icon

Fields.Name: DisplayComponentConfiguration
Fields.Description: If DisplayComponentID is specified, this field can optionally be used to track component-specific and relationship-specific configuration details that will be used by CodeGen to provide to the display component selected.

entities.Name: Explorer Navigation Items
entities.Description: Table to store navigation items for MemberJunction Explorer

Fields.Name: ID
Fields.Description: Unique identifier for each navigation item

Fields.Name: Sequence
Fields.Description: Sequence number for the navigation item, must be unique and greater than 0

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Description: Unique name of the navigation item displayed to the user

Fields.Name: Route
Fields.Description: The route for the navigation item relative to the app main URL, using Angular syntax like "entity/:entityName"

Fields.Name: IsActive
Fields.Description: Indicates if the navigation item is active; allows turning off items in the UI without deleting them from the metadata

Fields.Name: ShowInHomeScreen
Fields.Description: Controls if the navigation item is shown on the Home screen for MJ Explorer

Fields.Name: ShowInNavigationDrawer
Fields.Description: Controls if the item is shown in the left navigation drawer in the MJ Explorer app or not.

Fields.Name: IconCSSClass
Fields.Description: Optional, CSS class for an icon to be displayed with the navigation item

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the navigation item, shown to the user on hover or in larger displays

Fields.Name: Comments
Fields.Description: Administrator comments, not shown to the end user in MJ Explorer app

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Pending, Uploading, Uploaded, Deleting, Deleted

entities.Name: Integration URL Formats
entities.Description: Used to generate web links for end users to easily access resources in a source system. URL Formats support templating to inject various field values at run-time to take a user directly to a resource in a source system.

Fields.Name: URLFormat
Fields.Description: The URL Format for the given integration including the ability to include markup with fields from the integration

entities.Name: Integrations
entities.Description: Catalog of all integrations that have been configured in the system.

entities.Name: Libraries
entities.Description: Stores information about the available libraries, including a list of classes/functions, type definitions, and sample code. You can add additional custom libraries here to make them avaialable to code generation features within the system.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Status of the library, only libraries marked as Active will be available for use by generated code. If a library was once active but no longer is, existing code that used the library will not be affected.

Fields.Name: TypeDefinitions
Fields.Description: Code showing the types and functions defined in the library to be used for reference by humans and AI

Fields.Name: SampleCode
Fields.Description: Examples of code use of the classes and/or functions from within the library

entities.Name: Library Items
entities.Description: Table to store individual library items

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: Type of the library item for example Class, Interface, etc.

entities.Name: List Details
entities.Description: Tracks the records within each list.

entities.Name: Lists
entities.Description: Static lists are useful for controlling a set of data for a given entity. These can be used programatically for applications like logging and tracking long-running tasks and also by end users for tracking any particular list of records they want to directly control the set.

entities.Name: Queries
entities.Description: Catalog of stored queries. This is useful for any arbitrary query that is known to be performant and correct and can be reused. Queries can be viewed/run by a user, used programatically via RunQuery, and also used by AI systems for improved reliability instead of dynamically generated SQL. Queries can also improve security since they store the SQL instead of using dynamic SQL.

Fields.Name: QualityRank
Fields.Description: Value indicating the quality of the query, higher values mean a better quality

Fields.Name: ExecutionCostRank
Fields.Description: Higher numbers indicate more execution overhead/time required. Useful for planning which queries to use in various scenarios.

Fields.Name: SQLBaseType
Fields.Description: The base type, not including parameters, in SQL. For example this field would be nvarchar or decimal, and wouldn't include type parameters. The SQLFullType field provides that information.

Fields.Name: SQLFullType
Fields.Description: The full SQL type for the field, for example datetime or nvarchar(10) etc.

entities.Name: Queues
entities.Description: Queues can be used to async execute long running tasks

entities.Name: Recommendation Items
entities.Description: Table to store individual recommendation items that are the right side of the recommendation which we track in the DestinationEntityID/DestinationEntityRecordID

Fields.Name: DestinationEntityRecordID
Fields.Description: The record ID of the destination entity

Fields.Name: MatchProbability
Fields.Description: A value between 0 and 1 indicating the probability of the match, higher numbers indicating a more certain match/recommendation.

entities.Name: Recommendation Providers
entities.Description: Recommendation providers details

entities.Name: Recommendation Runs
entities.Description: Recommendation runs log each time a provider is requested to provide recommendations

Fields.Name: StartDate
Fields.Description: The start date of the recommendation run

Fields.Name: EndDate
Fields.Description: The end date of the recommendation run

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: The status of the recommendation run

entities.Name: Recommendations
entities.Description: Recommendation headers that store the left side of the recommendation which we track in the SourceEntityID/SourceEntityRecordID

Fields.Name: SourceEntityRecordID
Fields.Description: The record ID of the source entity

entities.Name: Record Change Replay Runs
entities.Description: Table to track the runs of replaying external record changes

Fields.Name: StartedAt
Fields.Description: Timestamp when the replay run started

Fields.Name: EndedAt
Fields.Description: Timestamp when the replay run ended

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Status of the replay run (Pending, In Progress, Complete, Error)

entities.Name: Record Changes
entities.Description: For entities that have TrackRecordChanges=1, Record Changes will store the history of all changes made within the system. For integrations you can directly add values here if you have inbound signals indicating records were changed in a source system. This entity only automatically captures Record Changes if they were made within the system.

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: Create, Update, or Delete

Fields.Name: Source
Fields.Description: Internal or External

Fields.Name: ChangedAt
Fields.Description: The date/time that the change occured.

Fields.Name: ChangesJSON
Fields.Description: JSON structure that describes what was changed in a structured format.

Fields.Name: ChangesDescription
Fields.Description: A generated, human-readable description of what was changed.

Fields.Name: FullRecordJSON
Fields.Description: A complete snapshot of the record AFTER the change was applied in a JSON format that can be parsed.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: For internal record changes generated within MJ, the status is immediately Complete. For external changes that are detected, the workflow starts off as Pending, then In Progress and finally either Complete or Error

entities.Name: Roles
entities.Description: Roles are used for security administration and can have zero to many Users as members

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the role

Fields.Name: DirectoryID
Fields.Description: The unique ID of the role in the directory being used for authentication, for example an ID in Azure.

Fields.Name: SQLName
Fields.Description: The name of the role in the database, this is used for auto-generating permission statements by CodeGen

entities.Name: Scheduled Actions
entities.Description: Track scheduled actions and their details

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: Type of the scheduled action (Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Yearly, Custom)

Fields.Name: CronExpression
Fields.Description: Cron expression defining the schedule, automatically maintained by the system unless Type is Custom, in which case the user directly sets this

Fields.Name: Timezone
Fields.Description: Timezone for the scheduled action, if not specified defaults to UTC/Z

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Status of the scheduled action (Pending, Active, Disabled, Expired)

Fields.Name: IntervalDays
Fields.Description: Interval in days for the scheduled action

Fields.Name: DayOfWeek
Fields.Description: Day of the week for the scheduled action

Fields.Name: DayOfMonth
Fields.Description: Day of the month for the scheduled action

Fields.Name: Month
Fields.Description: Month for the scheduled action

entities.Name: Schema Info
entities.Description: Tracks the schemas in the system and the ID ranges that are valid for entities within each schema.

entities.Name: Skills
entities.Description: A hierarchical list of possible skills that are linked to Employees and can also be linked to any other entity

entities.Name: Tagged Items
entities.Description: Tracks the links between any record in any entity with Tags

entities.Name: Tags
entities.Description: Tags are used to arbitrarily associate any record in any entity with addtional information.

entities.Name: Template Categories
entities.Description: Template categories for organizing templates

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Description: Name of the template category

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the template category

entities.Name: Template Content Types
entities.Description: Template content types for categorizing content within templates

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Description: Name of the template content type

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the template content type

Fields.Name: CodeType
Fields.Description: Refers to the primary language or codetype of the templates of this type, HTML, JSON, JavaScript, etc

entities.Name: Template Contents
entities.Description: Template content for different versions of a template for purposes like HTML/Text/etc

Fields.Name: TemplateText
Fields.Description: The actual text content for the template

Fields.Name: Priority
Fields.Description: Priority of the content version, higher priority versions will be used ahead of lower priority versions for a given Type

Fields.Name: IsActive
Fields.Description: Indicates whether the content is active or not. Use this to disable a particular Template Content item without having to remove it

entities.Name: Template Params
entities.Description: Parameters allowed for use inside the template

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Description: Name of the parameter

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the parameter

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: Type of the parameter - Record is an individual record within the entity specified by EntityID. Entity means an entire Entity or an entity filtered by the LinkedParameterName/Field attributes and/or ExtraFilter. Object is any valid JSON object. Array and Scalar have their common meanings.

Fields.Name: DefaultValue
Fields.Description: Default value of the parameter

Fields.Name: LinkedParameterName
Fields.Description: Only used when Type=Entity, this is used to link an Entity parameter with another parameter so that the rows in the Entity parameter can be filtered automatically based on the FKEY relationship between the Record and this Entity parameter. For example, if the Entity-based parameter is for an entity like Activities and there is another parameter of type Record for an entity like Contacts, in that situation the Activities Parameter would point to the Contacts parameter as the LinkedParameterName because we would filter down the Activities in each template render to only those linked to the Contact.

Fields.Name: LinkedParameterField
Fields.Description: If the LinkedParameterName is specified, this is an optional setting to specify the field within the LinkedParameter that will be used for filtering. This is only needed if there is more than one foreign key relationship between the Entity parameter and the Linked parameter, or if there is no defined foreign key in the database between the two entities.

Fields.Name: ExtraFilter
Fields.Description: Only used when Type = Entity, used to specify an optional filter to reduce the set of rows that are returned for each of the templates being rendered.

Fields.Name: RecordID
Fields.Description: Record ID, used only when Type is Record and a specific hardcoded record ID is desired, this is an uncommon use case, helpful for pulling in static types and metadata in some cases.

entities.Name: Templates
entities.Description: Templates are used for dynamic expansion of a static template with data from a given context. Templates can be used to create documents, messages and anything else that requires dynamic document creation merging together static text, data and lightweight logic

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Description: Name of the template

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the template

Fields.Name: UserPrompt
Fields.Description: This prompt will be used by the AI to generate template content as requested by the user.

Fields.Name: ActiveAt
Fields.Description: Optional, if provided, this template will not be available for use until the specified date. Requires IsActive to be set to 1

Fields.Name: DisabledAt
Fields.Description: Optional, if provided, this template will not be available for use after the specified date. If IsActive=0, this has no effect.

Fields.Name: IsActive
Fields.Description: If set to 0, the template will be disabled regardless of the values in ActiveAt/DisabledAt.

entities.Name: User Favorites
entities.Description: Records that each user can mark as a favorite for easy access

entities.Name: User View Run Details
entities.Description: Tracks the set of records that were included in each run of a given user view.

entities.Name: User View Runs
entities.Description: User Views can be logged when run to capture the date and user that ran the view as well as the output results.

entities.Name: User Views
entities.Description: Views are sets of records within a given entity defined by filtering rules. Views can be used programatically to retrieve dynamic sets of data and in user interfaces like MJ Explorer for end-user consumption.

entities.Name: Users
entities.Description: A list of all users who have or had access to the system

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: What type of installation was applied

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Pending, Complete, Failed

Fields.Name: InstallLog
Fields.Description: Any logging that was saved from the installation process

Fields.Name: Comments
Fields.Description: Optional, comments the administrator wants to save for each installed version

Fields.Name: AutoRunEnabled
Fields.Description: If set to 1, the workflow will be run automatically on the interval specified by the AutoRunIntervalType and AutoRunInterval fields

Fields.Name: AutoRunIntervalUnits
Fields.Description: Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Months, Years

Fields.Name: AutoRunInterval
Fields.Description: The interval, denominated in the units specified in the AutoRunIntervalUnits column, between auto runs of this workflow.

Fields.Name: SubclassName
Fields.Description: If specified, this subclass key, via the ClassFactory, will be instantiated, to execute this workflow. If not specified the WorkflowBase class will be used by default.

entities.Name: Workspace Items
entities.Description: Tracks the resources that are active within a given worksapce

entities.Name: Workspaces
entities.Description: A user can have one or more workspaces
